Sure, here is an outline for "The Ultimate Pre-Construction Checklist" article:

H1: The Ultimate Pre-Construction Checklist: A Construction Lawyer's Perspective
================================================================================

H2: Introduction (100-200 words)
--------------------------------

* Brief overview of the importance of a pre-construction checklist for homeowners
* Explanation of the benefits of having a construction lawyer's perspective when creating a pre-construction checklist

H2: What to Include in Your Pre-Construction Checklist (300-400 words)
----------------------------------------------------------------------

* Comprehensive list of items that should be included in a pre-construction checklist, such as budget, site selection, permits, contracts, and timeline management
* Explanation of why each item is important and how it contributes to the success of the construction project
* Use of subheadings for each item for clarity and organization

H2: Pre-Construction Planning Tips (200-300 words)
--------------------------------------------------

* Advice for homeowners on how to effectively plan their pre-construction checklist, such as setting realistic goals and expectations, researching building codes and regulations, and consulting with professionals
* Explanation of how proper planning can help avoid budget blowouts, project delays, and legal disputes

H2: Importance of a Detailed Contract (200-300 words)
-----------------------------------------------------

* Explanation of why a detailed contract is essential for a successful construction project, including the roles and responsibilities of each party, payment terms, and warranties
* Discussion of common contract disputes and how they can be avoided through a well-drafted contract
* Tips for negotiating and amending contracts to reflect the homeowner's intentions

H2: Pre-Construction Checklist Mistakes to Avoid (100-200 words)
----------------------------------------------------------------

* Common mistakes that homeowners make when creating a pre-construction checklist, such as failing to plan for contingencies, not understanding building codes and regulations, and not communicating effectively with the builder
* Explanation of how these mistakes can lead to budget blowouts, project delays, and legal disputes
* Tips for avoiding these mistakes and effectively managing the pre-construction checklist

H2: Conclusion (100-200 words)
------------------------------

* Recap of the importance of a pre-construction checklist for homeowners
* Emphasis on the benefits of using a construction lawyer's perspective when creating a pre-construction checklist
* Call to action for homeowners to seek legal advice and assistance when creating their pre-construction checklist

Total word count: 1,100 - 1,500 words (depending on the length of each section)

The H1 tag is used for the main heading of the article, while H2 tags are used for the main sections of the article. H3 tags can be used for subheadings within each section, if necessary.
